channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023070577
item.description:
Report X-2023070577

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE IN OUTBOUND TRAILER. SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND TAKEN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. RESPONDER FOUND THAT THE FIRE EXTINGUISHER DISCHARGED. PACKAGE WILL BE CONTAINED IN A DMP BAG FOR OUTSIDE VENDOR.

item.title: Report E-2023070946
item.description:
Report E-2023070946

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Veolia employee were loading the IBC onto a trailer at the 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when a leak was identified as coming from the bottom valve of the container. Upon further inspection, the valve completely snapped off resulting in a release of approximately 25 gallons of material onto the trailer floor and to the pavement beneath the trailer. The spill was quickly cleaned up and the remaining material in the IBC was transferred into a 55 gallon drum. The NRC was notified to report the release of a D003 material that exceed the RQ limit of 100 lbs.

item.title: Report X-2023071211
item.description:
Report X-2023071211

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the shipment upside down in a hazmat tote. upon inspection found there to b 6 4-liter inner boxes. 0ne of the inner boxes has leaked out all of its contents. 2 of the inner boxes are fully regulated(un1993), 3 of the inner boxes are non-regulated. the one that is damaged is un-regulated, the contents of spilled out and damaged the boxes of all other inner boxes. DescribePack: the cap and seal failed causing the contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put into a damaged hazmat was put into a plastic spill bag, then into a Damaged hazmat tote. lastly it was put into the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070991
item.description:
Report X-2023070991

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found in the hazmat cage. looks as if the box was dropped. DescribePack: One of the three plastic bottles had a loose and miss aligned cap. a trace amount leaked out. The inner packing material or the lack thereof contributed to the damage and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put into a plastic spill bag and then into a black tote.

item.title: Report X-2023071172
item.description:
Report X-2023071172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was pulled off trailer leaking. QA was called over and package was brought to the QA work area. Package has a sharp cut on exterior packaging, this was deep enough to get one of the bottles inside, causing leakage. Package handlers did not have further information on the situation. DescribePack: Small 1inch cut on bottom side of container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediate call to QA.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one poly 5 gallon pail of adhesive(1133) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 20 gallon drum of aqua clear (un2014) had been punctured by a sharp object and had released 3 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023070238
item.description:
Report X-2023070238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: WAUKESHA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28th, a package was offered that contained UN1814 Potassium Hydroxide Solution, 8, PGIII. The package was found during the evening sort and it was leaking. The spill was cleaned up, placed in a salvage drum and returned to the shipper. DG Admin also advised hte station that since the UN Spec code was partially covered that the package should not have been accepted and to let the shipper know that in the future, any packages labeled like that will be bumped.

item.title: Report X-2023061451
item.description:
Report X-2023061451

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE PINK SLIDE. AFTER ARRIVING WEARING PROPER PPE REPONDER NOTICED A LARGE PUDDLE ON THE SLIDE AND THE GROUND UNDER THE SLIDE. RESPONDER TOLD EMPLOYEES TO LEAVE THE AREA WHEN IT WAS SEEN THAT A HAZMAT WAS LEAKING. PROCCEDED TO FOLLOW THE DESCISION TREE TO PROPERLY CLEAN UP SPILL AND RETURN TO DMP FOR PROCCESSING.
